section.name: Integrity Defined 2
section.body: For the second time: According to the Oxford English Dictionary, integrity, in a moral sense, is: Soundness of moral principle; the character of uncorrupted virtue, especially in relation to truth and fair dealing; uprightness, honesty, sincerity. Try not to become a man of success. Rather become a man of value. - Albert Einstein (1879 – 1955)
